text:
President Trump posed with Robert Kraft and Bill Belichick during the Patriots’ visit to the White House in 2017.

President Trump wasn’t happy when Tom Brady said he would not visit the White House with the Super Bowl champion New England Patriots last year, citing family obligations.

That’s according to a new Washington Post report on the furor surrounding the Philadelphia Eagles’ canceled visit.

Trump was furious when he found out Brady would not accompany his teammates to the White House last year, according to the Post, and made a call to team owner Robert Kraft.

“Trump grew angry in April 2017 when Tom Brady said he planned to skip the White House visit with the Patriots, huddling angrily with aides and even calling Patriots owner Robert Kraft. One former senior administration official described a chaotic scene unfolding over the heartlands of America, as Trump flew back from an event in Wisconsin. Trump made a number of calls and asked aides to help fix the situation, worried that Brady’s absence would reflect poorly on him.”

Despite the personal appeals, Brady did not make the trip to Washington. Brady reportedly skipped the visit in order to spend time with his mother, who was battling breast cancer.

Despite several of Brady’s teammates also declining to make the trip, the Patriots’ visit to the White House went ahead as scheduled.
